objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The authoring organization of the threat report and the provided YARA rules, as indicated by the author metadata in the rules and the Crown Copyright notice.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND C2 Server
objects.description: Hardcoded default C2 IP address present in the UMBRELLA STAND sample.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND hidden directory
objects.description: Hidden directory used to store UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling.

objects.name: Injected library
objects.description: Library injected into the init process (pid 1). Possibly the same file as 'reboot_hooker'.

objects.name: Shell command output file pattern
objects.description: File path pattern used to store the output of shell commands executed by UMBRELLA STAND.

objects.name: Command collection information file pattern
objects.description: File path pattern used to store collection information for shell command output.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND persistence library
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND component loaded via /etc/ld.so.preload for persistence.

objects.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking file
objects.description: File modified by UMBRELLA STAND to load a malicious library (libguic.so) for persistence.

objects.name: BusyBox tool path
objects.description: Path to the renamed BusyBox binary used by the actor.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND log file
objects.description: Log file path found in strings of UMBRELLA STAND tooling.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND watchdog (jvnlpe) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND component used to run and monitor the main networking binary (blghtd).

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND watchdog (jvnlpe) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND component used to run and monitor the main networking binary (blghtd).

objects.description: MD5 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND component responsible for initialization, launching injection, and starting jvnlpe.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND initializer (cisz) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND component responsible for initialization, launching injection, and starting jvnlpe.

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND loader (libguic.so) (MD5)

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND loader (libguic.so) (SHA1)

objects.name: Indicator for UMBRELLA STAND loader (libguic.so) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND component loaded using ldpreload and used to load cisz.

objects.description: MD5 hash of the UMBRELLA STAND component used to hook the reboot of the device.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: A collection of actor binaries designed to allow shell commands to be run on compromised embedded devices, specifically targeting FortiGate 100D series firewalls. It is intended to facilitate long-term access and contains remote shell execution functionality, configurable beacon frequency, configurable C2 IP address, and uses AES-Encrypted C2 communications. It has been observed deployed with publicly available tooling.

objects.name: shoe rack
objects.description: A previously unknown piece of malware identified on a device compromised by UMBRELLA STAND. Its functionality is beyond the scope of the report.

objects.name: coathanger
objects.description: A malware referenced in a separate report, noted for having considerable similarity in its loading components to those observed in UMBRELLA STAND.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: The producer of the FortiGate 100D series firewalls that were targeted by the UMBRELLA STAND malware.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
encrypted stack strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45
D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58
C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45
DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A
C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45
EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7}
// Key
        $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45
C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52
C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45
CF DC} // IV
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings, if string obfuscation is not present."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {ED B8 83 20}
        $ = "%s/%d.sv"
        $ = "%s/%s.ini"
        $ = "%s>%s 2>&1"
        $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/"
        $ = "/proc/%s/status"
        $ = "%*s %s"
        $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd"
        $ = "89.44.194.32"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        5 of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings present in tooling."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "LoadMsg"
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "error"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
custom base64 alphabet and encryption key reference."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:

        $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;"
        $ =
"ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012"

    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "dxumbsu"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "loadMsg"
        $ ="/SYSV64564856"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings used to configure injection."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/SYSV64564856"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "version 2"
        $ = "init_drivercheck"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies it’s process name

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to load via ldpreload.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process is still executing.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with tcpdump which can be, and was, used to perform packet captures.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS for communications with the C2 server.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
